wiki.content:
"Afro Blue" is a jazz standard composed by Mongo Santamaría.
 
 Coltrane's recordings of the piece have several features in common with his versions of "My Favorite Things", including a pulsating 3/4 jazz waltz rhythm, and a drone-like harmonic structure.
 
 It can be arranged in 6/8 or 3/4 time. If it is arranged in 6/8, it has a strong quarter note triplet feel; if it is arranged in 3/4, it has a strong dotted quarter note feel.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Afro Blue" is a jazz standard composed by Mongo Santamaría.  Coltrane's recordings of the piece have several features in common with his versions of "My Favorite Things", including a pulsating 3/4 jazz waltz rhythm, and a drone-like harmonic structure.  It can be arranged in 6/8 or 3/4 time. If it is arranged in 6/8, it has a strong quarter note triplet feel; if it is arranged in 3/4, it has a strong dotted quarter note feel.

track.name: Afro Blue
comments: wowweekazowee.... yes, that sums it up.  Well said pone2one.
the loudness of elvin during the theme @ 7:30 makes it so fucking intense!
It will never be any better than TRANE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
glass of whisky in hand, lights dimmed, coltrane on the stereo - life can be good sometimes!
Einfach schön und doch nicht Einfach...
E esse cigarro ? E essa musica perfeita ? E essa hipnose...

There is a correlation between the kind of music younger African (Americans) are listening to and the state of the political struggle. This straight ahead jazz is empowering and positive. So were the '60s.
Wow... The Live at Birdland version is definately one of the best pieces of music i've heard and will ever hear!!
but that isnt that live in jap is it?? anyway: marvelous, now i can go shavin ,  hanx...
So..that's the name of this great tune.
the live in japan version is so good
